document_data.title: Settlement
document_data.name: Dagger Falls
document_data.mainbody: '''Daggers Falls''' was a large, stone-walled town in the [[Daggerdale]] region of the [[Dalelands]]. The town was situated near a steep waterfall of the same name.
document_data.Defenses: Dagger Falls had a strong stone wall encompassing the town and whilst under the rule of [[Zhentil Keep]] boasted a garrison of 100 [[Zhentilar]] soldiers, 200 mercenaries, and roughly 130 Dalesmen reserves. Two gatehouses guarded the entrances to the town, holding 35 troops each, located by the northern forest gate and eastern river gate.
document_data.History:
The site was once used as a storage site for [[dwarven]] metals mined from the [[Desertsmouth Mountains]] to the east.

Dagger Falls had long been the seat of power for Daggerdale if only by virtue of it being the largest settlement. The [[Morn]] family ruled the dale from Dagger Falls for centuries until [[1336 DR]] when the [[Zhentarim]] agents deposed them.

The town was then primarily controlled by series of Zhentilar-nominated constables, who held it until Randal Morn's triumphant retaking of Dagger Falls in [[1369 DR]].

In [[1372]], it still existed as a frontier town under the authority of [[Randal Morn]], Lord of Daggerdale.

Shops.Fulgath's Caravan Supplies: This shop provided basic provisions and goods useful to [[merchant]]s, albeit at a 200% markup.
Shops.Market Square (Dagger Falls)|Market Squa: This was the town's open market area.
Shops.Old Dulwar's Leatherworks: This store operated as a safehouse during Randal Morn's resistance and rebellion against the Zhents.{{Cite dungeon/192/Backdrop: Daggerdale}}

Inns and taverns.Teshford Arms: This low quality inn, with exorbitant prices, was run by a matronly woman named [[Olavia]].
Inns and taverns.Broken Dagger: The epitome of rough-and-tumble bars whose patrons were primarily [[Zhent]]ish soldiers and mercenaries before the rebellion.
Inns and taverns.Red Rock: A ramshackled inn frequented by the country folk.

Temples.Lathander's Light: This formerly grand temple was destroyed in a fire during the war with the Zhents and rebuilt afterwards as a testament to their determination and resiliance.

Roads.Tethyamar Trail: The southbound road that continued to [[Serpentsbridge]] and [[Spiderhaunt Wood]]s.

Natural features.Dagger Falls (waterfall)|Dagger Falls: The eponymous waterfall had a sheer drop and was unnavigable by boats.
Natural features.Eagles' Eyrie: This rocky knoll was home to altars sacred to the [[Clan Brightblade]] of [[Dwarves]].
